alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 5:09PM EDT until May 26 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams and Brown. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving back into the advisory area. Many spots in the advisory area have already received 1 to 2 inches of rain in the past 24 hours, so additional heavy rain will lead to rapid runoff. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Peebles, Ripley, Aberdeen, Winchester, Seaman, Lewisburg, Decatur, Mount Olivet, Cherry Fork, Sardis, Concord, Bentonville, Bradysville, Trinity, Rectorville and Somo.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
